page.title: 05GROBY -WHAT A NAME!
page.content: {Groby}is a funny word especially when you realise that it's pronounced GROOBY-very confusing! It started as {Grobi}in the original Domesday Book,but by the twelfth century had become {Groubi}and then {Groebi}.However in 1279{Groby}appeared and nothing much changed until 1564 when it was known as{Growbye}.Only twelve years after that it had become {Groobye}but then through most of the 17th century{Groby}came back into fashion.In 1692 it briefly reverted to {Groobye}before becoming{Groby}for most of the 18th century.The 19th century was totally dominated by yet another version{Grooby}and this was used on the first Ordnace Survey Maps of 1835. Here we are back to the present with { {Groby}pronounced GROOBY.
